answers.answer: Uh no. Ice is water lol and you need lots of water. If you wanna eat ice go for it

Ice will not create preeclampsia, but if you are craving ice or it tastes unusually delicious, that is a sign of anemia.  Anemia can definitely happen during pregnancy -- you're producing blood for two -- and if you have it you should be diagnosed so you can increase your iron intake.  Either that or just begin to take an iron supplement on top of your prenatal, (and probably a fiber gummy too because iron can be so constipating), and see if you feel more energetic and/or if your ice cravings change to something more like your intake before pregnancy.  I don't know if anemia can cause preeclampsia ... if so, that might be the connection people are making.  Not ice creates preeclampsia but ice cravings suggest anemia which can cause preecampsia.  But I don't know if there is that link or not.  Anyway, in your shoes I'd take some iron.

question: I'm at work and I love to eat ice its more refreshing then water but everyone at my job keeps saying it causes pre eclampsia has any one ever heard of this
title: ice
